nodes.bodyText: background color is not a css rule background-color is
!important needs to come before the semicolon
url needs to be applied to a rule
url needs to be applied to a rule

Being a longer line I guess, this has highlighted to me the pattern of duplication we have in here of lines which are definitely prone to typo errors. Like we've done in the Core package.json, should we start using the package.json config object?
So here we could add:
"config": {
  "stylesheet_glob": "\"Source/Plugins/Core/com.equella.core/{js,resources}/**/*.{css,scss}\""
}
And then we simply have:
"format:scss": "prettier --write ${npm_package_config_stylesheet_glob}",
.
.
.
"check:scss": "prettier --check ${npm_package_config_stylesheet_glob}",
And later we can come back and address the others. (Or if you're willing, I see now harm in updating the others now as part of this.)
